properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: activate
properties.description: (Optional) Conditionally prevents the Service from being activated. The apply step will continue to create a new draft version but will not activate it if this is set to false. Default true.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The unique name for the Service to create.

properties.name: comment
properties.description: (Optional) Description field for the service. Default Managed by Terraform.

properties.name: version_comment
properties.description: (Optional) Description field for the version.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: (Required) A set of Domain names to serve as entry points for your Service. Defined below.

properties.name: backend
properties.description: (Optional) A set of Backends to service requests from your Domains. Defined below. Backends must be defined in this argument, or defined in the vcl argument below

properties.name: condition
properties.description: (Optional) A set of conditions to add logic to any basic configuration object in this service. Defined below.

properties.name: cache_setting
properties.description: (Optional) A set of Cache Settings, allowing you to override

properties.name: director
properties.description: (Optional) A director to allow more control over balancing traffic over backends. when an item is not to be cached based on an above condition. Defined below

properties.name: gzip
properties.description: (Required) A set of gzip rules to control automatic gzipping of content. Defined below.

properties.name: header
properties.description: (Optional) A set of Headers to manipulate for each request. Defined below.

properties.name: healthcheck
properties.description: (Optional) Automated healthchecks on the cache that can change how Fastly interacts with the cache based on its health.

properties.name: default_host
properties.description: (Optional) The default hostname.

properties.name: default_ttl
properties.description: (Optional) The default Time-to-live (TTL) for requests.

properties.name: force_destroy
properties.description: (Optional) Services that are active cannot be destroyed. In order to destroy the Service, set force_destroy to true. Default false.

properties.name: request_setting
properties.description: (Optional) A set of Request modifiers. Defined below

properties.name: s3logging
properties.description: (Optional) A set of S3 Buckets to send streaming logs too. Defined below.

properties.name: papertrail
properties.description: (Optional) A Papertrail endpoint to send streaming logs too. Defined below.

properties.name: sumologic
properties.description: (Optional) A Sumologic endpoint to send streaming logs too. Defined below.

properties.name: gcslogging
properties.description: (Optional) A gcs endpoint to send streaming logs too. Defined below.

properties.name: bigquerylogging
properties.description: (Optional) A BigQuery endpoint to send streaming logs too. Defined below.

properties.name: syslog
properties.description: (Optional) A syslog endpoint to send streaming logs too. Defined below.

properties.name: logentries
properties.description: (Optional) A logentries endpoint to send streaming logs too. Defined below.

properties.name: splunk
properties.description: (Optional) A Splunk endpoint to send streaming logs too. Defined below.

properties.name: blobstoragelogging
properties.description: (Optional) An Azure Blob Storage endpoint to send streaming logs too. Defined below.

properties.name: response_object
properties.description: (Optional) Allows you to create synthetic responses that exist entirely on the varnish machine. Useful for creating error or maintenance pages that exists outside the scope of your datacenter. Best when used with Condition objects.

properties.name: snippet
properties.description: (Optional) A set of custom, "regular" (non-dynamic) VCL Snippet configuration blocks. Defined below.

properties.name: dynamicsnippet
properties.description: (Optional) A set of custom, "dynamic" VCL Snippet configuration blocks. Defined below.

properties.name: vcl
properties.description: (Optional) A set of custom VCL configuration blocks. The ability to upload custom VCL code is not enabled by default for new Fastly accounts (see the Fastly documentation for details).

properties.name: acl
properties.description: (Optional) A set of ACL configuration blocks. Defined below.

properties.name: dictionary
properties.description: (Optional) A set of dictionaries that allow the storing of key values pair for use within VCL functions. Defined below.
The domain block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The domain to which this Service will respond.

properties.name: comment
properties.description: (Optional) An optional comment about the Domain.
The backend block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string) Name for this Backend. Must be unique to this Service.

properties.name: address
properties.description: (Required, string) An IPv4, hostname, or IPv6 address for the Backend.

properties.name: auto_loadbalance
properties.description: (Optional, boolean) Denotes if this Backend should be included in the pool of backends that requests are load balanced against. Default true.

properties.name: between_bytes_timeout
properties.description: (Optional) How long to wait between bytes in milliseconds. Default 10000.

properties.name: connect_timeout
properties.description: (Optional) How long to wait for a timeout in milliseconds. Default 1000

properties.name: error_threshold
properties.description: (Optional) Number of errors to allow before the Backend is marked as down. Default 0.

properties.name: first_byte_timeout
properties.description: (Optional) How long to wait for the first bytes in milliseconds. Default 15000.

properties.name: max_conn
properties.description: (Optional) Maximum number of connections for this Backend. Default 200.

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Optional) The port number on which the Backend responds. Default 80.

properties.name: override_host
properties.description: (Optional) The hostname to override the Host header.

properties.name: request_condition
properties.description: (Optional, string) Name of already defined condition, which if met, will select this backend during a request.

properties.name: use_ssl
properties.description: (Optional) Whether or not to use SSL to reach the backend. Default false.

properties.name: max_tls_version
properties.description: (Optional) Maximum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.

properties.name: min_tls_version
properties.description: (Optional) Minimum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.

properties.name: ssl_ciphers
properties.description: (Optional) Comma separated list of OpenSSL Ciphers to try when negotiating to the backend.

properties.name: ssl_ca_cert
properties.description: (Optional) CA certificate attached to origin.

properties.name: ssl_client_cert
properties.description: (Optional) Client certificate attached to origin. Used when connecting to the backend.

properties.name: ssl_client_key
properties.description: (Optional) Client key attached to origin. Used when connecting to the backend.

properties.name: ssl_check_cert
properties.description: (Optional) Be strict about checking SSL certs. Default true.

properties.name: ssl_hostname
properties.description: (Optional, deprecated by Fastly) Used for both SNI during the TLS handshake and to validate the cert.

properties.name: ssl_cert_hostname
properties.description: (Optional) Overrides ssl_hostname, but only for cert verification. Does not affect SNI at all.

properties.name: ssl_sni_hostname
properties.description: (Optional) Overrides ssl_hostname, but only for SNI in the handshake. Does not affect cert validation at all.

properties.name: shield
properties.description: (Optional) The POP of the shield designated to reduce inbound load.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: (Optional) The portion of traffic to send to this Backend. Each Backend receives weight / total of the traffic. Default 100.

properties.name: healthcheck
properties.description: (Optional) Name of a defined healthcheck to assign to this backend.

The condition block supports allows you to add logic to any basic configuration object in a service. See Fastly's documentation "About Conditions" for more detailed information on using Conditions. The Condition name can be used in the request_condition, response_condition, or cache_condition attributes of other block settings.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The unique name for the condition.

properties.name: statement
properties.description: (Required) The statement used to determine if the condition is met.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Type of condition, either REQUEST (req), RESPONSE (req, resp), or CACHE (req, beresp).

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) A number used to determine the order in which multiple conditions execute. Lower numbers execute first. Default 10.
The director block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Unique name for this Director.

properties.name: backends
properties.description: (Required) Names of defined backends to map the director to. Example: [ "origin1", "origin2" ]

properties.name: comment
properties.description: (Optional) An optional comment about the Director.

properties.name: shield
properties.description: (Optional) Selected POP to serve as a "shield" for origin servers.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: (Optional) Load balancing weight for the backends. Default 100.

properties.name: quorum
properties.description: (Optional) Percentage of capacity that needs to be up for the director itself to be considered up. Default 75.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Type of load balance group to use. Integer, 1 to 4. Values: 1 (random), 3 (hash), 4 (client). Default 1.

properties.name: retries
properties.description: (Optional) How many backends to search if it fails. Default 5.
The cache_setting block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Unique name for this Cache Setting.

properties.name: action
properties.description: (Optional) One of cache, pass, or restart, as defined on Fastly's documentation under "Caching action descriptions".

properties.name: cache_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition used to test whether this settings object should be used. This condition must be of type CACHE.

properties.name: stale_ttl
properties.description: (Optional) Max "Time To Live" for stale (unreachable) objects.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: (Optional) The Time-To-Live (TTL) for the object.
The gzip block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name.

properties.name: content_types
properties.description: (Optional) The content-type for each type of content you wish to have dynamically gzip'ed. Example: ["text/html", "text/css"].

properties.name: extensions
properties.description: (Optional) File extensions for each file type to dynamically gzip. Example: ["css", "js"].

properties.name: cache_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition controlling when this gzip configuration applies. This condition must be of type CACHE. For detailed information about Conditionals, see Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals.

The Header block supports adding, removing, or modifying Request and Response headers. See Fastly's documentation on Adding or modifying headers on HTTP requests and responses for more detailed information on any of the properties below.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Unique name for this header attribute.

properties.name: action
properties.description: (Required) The Header manipulation action to take; must be one of set, append, delete, regex, or regex_repeat.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The Request type on which to apply the selected Action; must be one of request, fetch, cache or response.

properties.name: destination
properties.description: (Required) The name of the header that is going to be affected by the Action.

properties.name: ignore_if_set
properties.description: (Optional) Do not add the header if it is already present. (Only applies to the set action.). Default false.

properties.name: source
properties.description: (Optional) Variable to be used as a source for the header content. (Does not apply to the delete action.)

properties.name: regex
properties.description: (Optional) Regular expression to use (Only applies to the regex and regex_repeat actions.)

properties.name: substitution
properties.description: (Optional) Value to substitute in place of regular expression. (Only applies to the regex and regex_repeat actions.)

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) Lower priorities execute first. Default: 100.

properties.name: request_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to apply. This condition must be of type REQUEST.

properties.name: cache_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to apply. This condition must be of type CACHE.

properties.name: response_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to apply. This condition must be of type RESPONSE. For detailed information about Conditionals, see Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals.
The healthcheck block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify this Healthcheck.

properties.name: host
properties.description: (Required) The Host header to send for this Healthcheck.

properties.name: path
properties.description: (Required) The path to check.

properties.name: check_interval
properties.description: (Optional) How often to run the Healthcheck in milliseconds. Default 5000.

properties.name: expected_response
properties.description: (Optional) The status code expected from the host. Default 200.

properties.name: http_version
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to use version 1.0 or 1.1 HTTP. Default 1.1.

properties.name: initial
properties.description: (Optional) When loading a config, the initial number of probes to be seen as OK. Default 2.

properties.name: method
properties.description: (Optional) Which HTTP method to use. Default HEAD.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: (Optional) How many Healthchecks must succeed to be considered healthy. Default 3.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional) Timeout in milliseconds. Default 500.

properties.name: window
properties.description: (Optional) The number of most recent Healthcheck queries to keep for this Healthcheck. Default 5.
The request_setting block allow you to customize Fastly's request handling, by defining behavior that should change based on a predefined condition:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The domain for this request setting.

properties.name: request_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to determine if this request setting should be applied.

properties.name: max_stale_age
properties.description: (Optional) How old an object is allowed to be to serve stale-if-error or stale-while-revalidate, in seconds.

properties.name: force_miss
properties.description: (Optional) Force a cache miss for the request. If specified, can be true or false.

properties.name: force_ssl
properties.description: (Optional) Forces the request to use SSL (Redirects a non-SSL request to SSL).

properties.name: action
properties.description: (Optional) Allows you to terminate request handling and immediately perform an action. When set it can be lookup or pass (Ignore the cache completely).

properties.name: bypass_busy_wait
properties.description: (Optional) Disable collapsed forwarding, so you don't wait for other objects to origin.

properties.name: hash_keys
properties.description: (Optional) Comma separated list of varnish request object fields that should be in the hash key.

properties.name: xff
properties.description: (Optional) X-Forwarded-For, should be clear, leave, append, append_all, or overwrite. Default append.

properties.name: timer_support
properties.description: (Optional) Injects the X-Timer info into the request for viewing origin fetch durations.

properties.name: geo_headers
properties.description: (Optional) Injects Fastly-Geo-Country, Fastly-Geo-City, and Fastly-Geo-Region into the request headers.

properties.name: default_host
properties.description: (Optional) Sets the host header.
The s3logging block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify this S3 Logging Bucket.

properties.name: bucket_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the bucket in which to store the logs.

properties.name: s3_access_key
properties.description: (Required) AWS Access Key of an account with the required permissions to post logs. It is strongly recommended you create a separate IAM user with permissions to only operate on this Bucket. This key will be not be encrypted. You can provide this key via an environment variable, FASTLY_S3_ACCESS_KEY.

properties.name: s3_secret_key
properties.description: (Required) AWS Secret Key of an account with the required permissions to post logs. It is strongly recommended you create a separate IAM user with permissions to only operate on this Bucket. This secret will be not be encrypted. You can provide this secret via an environment variable, FASTLY_S3_SECRET_KEY.

properties.name: path
properties.description: (Optional) Path to store the files. Must end with a trailing slash. If this field is left empty, the files will be saved in the bucket's root path.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: (Optional) If you created the S3 bucket outside of us-east-1, then specify the corresponding bucket endpoint. Example: s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com.

properties.name: period
properties.description: (Optional) How frequently the logs should be transferred, in seconds. Default 3600.

properties.name: gzip_level
properties.description: (Optional) Level of GZIP compression, from 0-9. 0 is no compression. 1 is fastest and least compressed, 9 is slowest and most compressed. Default 0.

properties.name: format
properties.description: (Optional) Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (%h %l %u %t %r %>s)

properties.name: format_version
properties.description: (Optional) The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 (the default, version 1 log format) or 2 (the version 2 log format).

properties.name: message_type
properties.description: (Optional) How the message should be formatted; one of: classic, loggly, logplex or blank. Default classic.

properties.name: timestamp_format
properties.description: (Optional) strftime specified timestamp formatting (default %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.000).

properties.name: redundancy
properties.description: (Optional) The S3 redundancy level. Should be formatted; one of: standard, reduced_redundancy or null. Default null.

properties.name: response_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to apply. This condition must be of type RESPONSE. For detailed information about Conditionals, see Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: (Optional) Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: none or waf_debug.
The papertrail block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify this Papertrail endpoint.

properties.name: address
properties.description: (Required) The address of the Papertrail endpoint.

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) The port associated with the address where the Papertrail endpoint can be accessed.

properties.name: format
properties.description: (Optional) Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (%h %l %u %t %r %>s)

properties.name: response_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to apply. This condition must be of type RESPONSE. For detailed information about Conditionals, see Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: (Optional) Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: none or waf_debug.
The sumologic block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify this Sumologic endpoint.

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Required) The URL to Sumologic collector endpoint

properties.name: format
properties.description: (Optional) Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (%h %l %u %t %r %>s)

properties.name: format_version
properties.description: (Optional) The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 (the default, version 1 log format) or 2 (the version 2 log format).

properties.name: response_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to apply. This condition must be of type RESPONSE. For detailed information about Conditionals, see Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals.

properties.name: message_type
properties.description: (Optional) How the message should be formatted; one of: classic, loggly, logplex or blank. Default classic. See Fastly's Documentation on Sumologic

properties.name: placement
properties.description: (Optional) Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: none or waf_debug.
The gcslogging block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify this GCS endpoint.

properties.name: email
properties.description: (Required) The email address associated with the target GCS bucket on your account. You may optionally provide this secret via an environment variable, FASTLY_GCS_EMAIL.

properties.name: bucket_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the bucket in which to store the logs.

properties.name: secret_key
properties.description: (Required) The secret key associated with the target gcs bucket on your account. You may optionally provide this secret via an environment variable, FASTLY_GCS_SECRET_KEY. A typical format for the key is PEM format, containing actual newline characters where required.

properties.name: path
properties.description: (Optional) Path to store the files. Must end with a trailing slash. If this field is left empty, the files will be saved in the bucket's root path.

properties.name: period
properties.description: (Optional) How frequently the logs should be transferred, in seconds. Default 3600.

properties.name: gzip_level
properties.description: (Optional) Level of GZIP compression, from 0-9. 0 is no compression. 1 is fastest and least compressed, 9 is slowest and most compressed. Default 0.

properties.name: format
properties.description: (Optional) Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (%h %l %u %t %r %>s)

properties.name: response_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to apply. This condition must be of type RESPONSE. For detailed information about Conditionals, see Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals.

properties.name: message_type
properties.description: (Optional) How the message should be formatted; one of: classic, loggly, logplex or blank. Default classic. Fastly Documentation

properties.name: placement
properties.description: (Optional) Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: none or waf_debug.
The bigquerylogging block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify this BigQuery logging endpoint.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of your GCP project.

properties.name: dataset
properties.description: (Required) The ID of your BigQuery dataset.

properties.name: table
properties.description: (Required) The ID of your BigQuery table.

properties.name: email
properties.description: (Optional) The email for the service account with write access to your BigQuery dataset. If not provided, this will be pulled from a FASTLY_BQ_EMAIL environment variable.

properties.name: secret_key
properties.description: (Optional) The secret key associated with the sservice account that has write access to your BigQuery table. If not provided, this will be pulled from the FASTLY_BQ_SECRET_KEY environment variable. Typical format for this is a private key in a string with newlines.

properties.name: format
properties.description: (Optional) Apache style log formatting. Must produce JSON that matches the schema of your BigQuery table.

properties.name: response_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to apply. This condition must be of type RESPONSE. For detailed information about Conditionals, see Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals.

properties.name: template
properties.description: (Optional) Big query table name suffix template. If set will be interpreted as a strftime compatible string and used as the Template Suffix for your table.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: (Optional) Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: none or waf_debug.
The syslog block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify this Syslog endpoint.

properties.name: address
properties.description: (Required) A hostname or IPv4 address of the Syslog endpoint.

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Optional) The port associated with the address where the Syslog endpoint can be accessed. Default 514.

properties.name: format
properties.description: (Optional) Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (%h %l %u %t %r %>s)

properties.name: format_version
properties.description: (Optional) The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 (the default, version 1 log format) or 2 (the version 2 log format).

properties.name: token
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to prepend each message with a specific token.

properties.name: use_tls
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to use TLS for secure logging. Default false.

properties.name: tls_hostname
properties.description: (Optional) Used during the TLS handshake to validate the certificate.

properties.name: tls_ca_cert
properties.description: (Optional) A secure certificate to authenticate the server with.

properties.name: response_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to apply. This condition must be of type RESPONSE. For detailed information about Conditionals, see Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals.

properties.name: message_type
properties.description: (Optional) How the message should be formatted; one of: classic, loggly, logplex or blank. Default classic.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: (Optional) Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: none or waf_debug.
The logentries block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify this GCS endpoint.

properties.name: token
properties.description: (Required) Logentries Token to be used for authentication (https://logentries.com/doc/input-token/).

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Optional) The port number configured in Logentries to send logs to. Defaults to 20000.

properties.name: use_tls
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to use TLS for secure logging. Defaults to true

properties.name: format
properties.description: (Optional) Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (%h %l %u %t %r %>s).

properties.name: format_version
properties.description: (Optional) The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 (the default, version 1 log format) or 2 (the version 2 log format).

properties.name: response_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to apply. This condition must be of type RESPONSE. For detailed information about Conditionals, see Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: (Optional) Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: none or waf_debug.
The splunk block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify the Splunk endpoint.

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Required) The Splunk URL to stream logs to.

properties.name: token
properties.description: (Required) The Splunk token to be used for authentication.

properties.name: format
properties.description: (Optional) Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Default %h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b.

properties.name: format_version
properties.description: (Optional) The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. The logging call gets placed by default in vcl_log if format_version is set to 2 and in vcl_deliver if format_version is set to 1. Default 2.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: (Optional) Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed, overriding any format_version default. Can be either none or waf_debug.

properties.name: response_condition
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the condition to apply. If empty, always execute.
The blobstoragelogging block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify the Azure Blob Storage endpoint.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: (Required) The unique Azure Blob Storage namespace in which your data objects are stored.

properties.name: container
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Azure Blob Storage container in which to store logs.

properties.name: sas_token
properties.description: (Required) The Azure shared access signature providing write access to the blob service objects. Be sure to update your token before it expires or the logging functionality will not work.

properties.name: path
properties.description: (Optional) The path to upload logs to. Must end with a trailing slash. If this field is left empty, the files will be saved in the container's root path.

properties.name: period
properties.description: (Optional) How frequently the logs should be transferred in seconds. Default 3600.

properties.name: timestamp_format
properties.description: (Optional) strftime specified timestamp formatting. Default %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.000.

properties.name: gzip_level
properties.description: (Optional) Level of GZIP compression from 0to 9. 0 means no compression. 1 is the fastest and the least compressed version, 9 is the slowest and the most compressed version. Default 0.

properties.name: public_key
properties.description: (Optional) A PGP public key that Fastly will use to encrypt your log files before writing them to disk.

properties.name: format
properties.description: (Optional) Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Default %h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b.

properties.name: format_version
properties.description: (Optional) The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. The logging call gets placed by default in vcl_log if format_version is set to 2 and in vcl_deliver if format_version is set to 1. Default 2.

properties.name: message_type
properties.description: (Optional) How the message should be formatted. Can be either classic, loggly, logplex or blank. Default classic.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: (Optional) Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed, overriding any format_version default. Can be either none or waf_debug.

properties.name: response_condition
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the condition to apply. If empty, always execute.
The response_object block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify this Response Object.

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Optional) The HTTP Status Code. Default 200.

properties.name: response
properties.description: (Optional) The HTTP Response. Default Ok.

properties.name: content
properties.description: (Optional) The content to deliver for the response object.

properties.name: content_type
properties.description: (Optional) The MIME type of the content.

properties.name: request_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to be checked during the request phase. If the condition passes then this object will be delivered. This condition must be of type REQUEST.

properties.name: cache_condition
properties.description: (Optional) Name of already defined condition to check after we have retrieved an object. If the condition passes then deliver this Request Object instead. This condition must be of type CACHE. For detailed information about Conditionals, see Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals.
The snippet block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A name that is unique across "regular" and "dynamic" VCL Snippet configuration blocks.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The location in generated VCL where the snippet should be placed (can be one of init, recv, hit, miss, pass, fetch, error, deliver, log or none).

properties.name: content
properties.description: (Required) The VCL code that specifies exactly what the snippet does.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) Priority determines the ordering for multiple snippets. Lower numbers execute first. Defaults to 100.
The dynamicsnippet block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A name that is unique across "regular" and "dynamic" VCL Snippet configuration blocks.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The location in generated VCL where the snippet should be placed (can be one of init, recv, hit, miss, pass, fetch, error, deliver, log or none).

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) Priority determines the ordering for multiple snippets. Lower numbers execute first. Defaults to 100.
The vcl block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name for this configuration block.

properties.name: content
properties.description: (Required) The custom VCL code to upload.

properties.name: main
properties.description: (Optional) If true, use this block as the main configuration. If false, use this block as an includable library. Only a single VCL block can be marked as the main block. Default is false.
The acl block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify this ACL.
The dictionary block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A unique name to identify this dictionary.

properties.name: write_only
properties.description: (Optional) If true, the dictionary is a private dictionary, and items are not readable in the UI or via API. Default is false. It is important to note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the dictionary, discard the current items in the dictionary. Using a write-only/private dictionary should only be done if the items are managed outside of Terraform.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the service that the dictionary belongs to

properties.name: dictionary_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the dictionary that the items belong to

properties.name: items
properties.description: (Optional) A map representing an entry in the dictionary, (key/value)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Service that the ACL belongs to

properties.name: acl_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the ACL that the items belong to

properties.name: entry
properties.description: (Optional) A Set ACL entries that are applied to the service. Defined below
The entry block supports:

properties.name: ip
properties.description: (Required, string) An IP address that is the focus for the ACL

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: (Optional, string) An optional subnet mask applied to the IP address

properties.name: negated
properties.description: (Optional, boolean) A boolean that will negate the match if true

properties.name: comment
properties.description: (Optional, string) A personal freeform descriptive note
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the service that the dynamic snippet belongs to

properties.name: snippet_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the dynamic snippet that the content belong to

properties.name: content
properties.description: (Required) The VCL code that specifies exactly what the snippet does.
